Description: Segmental bowl with flared walls and a marked change in angle towards the base, a tapered straight rim and a rounded, slightly flattened, base; grey-light brown fabric with clearly visible micaceous inclusions, black slipped and burnished to a lustrous metallic sheen on both the interior and exterior with greyish patches on the interior where the slip has worn away, the black slip has also worn away slightly towards the rim to reveal the red-brown surface of the vessel beneath. Handmade. Complete and repaired with two small cracks in the rim.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (G4) Context 47f
Type series: NDRS type BO8 (published form type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.314, fig. 5.45)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 1298x (excavation type series number)
Excavation/small finds number: 942e (excavation type series number)
Excavation/small finds number: 958e (excavation type series number)
